intro: Egletes obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating, and its yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
